metadata.Title: CVE-2015-1258 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
Google Chrome before 43.0.2357.65 relies on libvpx code that was not built with an appropriate --size-limit value, which allows remote attackers to trigger a negative value for a size field, and consequently cause a denial of service or possibly have unspecified other impact, via a crafted frame size in VP9 video data.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1258` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-browser-l10n - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-chromedriver - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 43.0.2357.81-0ubuntu0.14.04.1.1089
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqmlscene - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-chromedriver - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.7.8-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
